text: Braddock is a borough in the eastern suburbs of Pittsburgh in Allegheny County, Pennsylvania, 10 miles (16 km) from the Monongahela River. The population was 1,721 at the 2020 census. The town is named for General Edward Braddock (1695â€“1755). Current US Senator Democrat John Fetterman was mayor from 2005 to 2019. ==References== Category:Boroughs in Allegheny County, Pennsylvania
title: Braddock, Pennsylvania
